title: February 4
description:
Milo's moving up in the world: he traded his crib for a genuine bed! We weren't even remotely thinking about new sleeping arrangements but Milo returned from Hawaii with the ability to say "aloha" to his crib. He shinnies right up and over. The bars were just making it harder to put him back in.

Milo enthusiastically helped disassemble his crib; yet, at the end, when he stepped back and surveyed the remnants of his bed, he cried and cried. That was pretty much the extent of his mourning. The first night we put him to bed there was a bit of whimpering for the old regime, but nothing since.

It's been a week of drawn-out bedtimes, trying to embed Milo. He revels in his freedom; drops out of bed commando-style, on all fours; and slowly pushes his door open. He keeps his head down because apparently "if I can't see them they can't see me". When we pick him up he looks astonished that we got past his cunning stratagem.

As of tonight we think we've finally licked it! He didn't get out of bed at all.

children.title: Big Boy Bed
children.description: Milo was very proud to show off his new bed to Corra.  She appreciated it so much she just shucked her clothes and got down to the business of sleeping.

children.title: Corra
children.description: Corra, a good friend of Milo's from school, came over for a playdate and had a great time. She cried leaving, and we heard she kept it up all the way home.

children.title: Corra & Mom
children.description:
Corra, her mom Joanne, and Milo.

Some in the two year old class are into books, some aren't. Corra and Milo count themselves as book lovers.

children.title: Vampire
children.description: Felix went to Evan's birthday bowling party and came back with a taste for blood.

children.title: Sofia
children.description: Sofia came for a sleepover. We love her! She's such a perfect houseguest and funny and creative to boot.

children.title: Bikes 1
children.description: Milo's finally figured out how to ride the tricycle, despite it being kind of broken.  We definitely owe him a better ride.

children.title: Bikes 2
children.description: Felix has started going to the end of the block by himself. He insists that the rest of us stay near the house. If he had his way, he'd be riding to school by himself. He does know the way and can describe it clearly when we ask.

children.title: Bikes 3
children.description: Our neighbors across the street are often play out in front.  It's nice to hang out with them.  The mom is Jeannie.  The 7 year old twins are Asher and Emma.  The 2 year old twins are Rena and Ezra.  The guy in the football jersey is another neighbor -- we should really learn his name!

children.title: Dean
children.description: For the rainy season, the weather's been fabulously sunny.  Unfortunately that's not so good for the water reservoirs.  They're saying that if next year is as dry as this year, California will run out of water.
